title: Stop the Stigma and Shift the Shame: A Spiritual Conversation About Mental Health and Trauma
description:
On Dear Gabby we pick people completely at random—we don’t have any information about where they are, who they are, what their questions might be. What's really interesting about this episode is that on this particular recording day, each of these women came on to speak on behalf of the same topic—unspoken shame. This was no accident. The Universe will always hook us up with what we need. The guests on this episode are brave souls who came forward to voice unspoken shame surrounding trauma, sexual abuse and mental illness. I hope this episode serves you greatly. I know that it has deeply served me.

On this episode you’ll hear:

  • Permission to give voice to the unspoken shame that the world has told us not to face.
  • Open, honest and raw personal stories from three women sharing their experiences with trauma, sexual assault and mental illness.
  • My own experience with childhood trauma, post-traumatic stress disorder and postpartum depression.
  • Guidance to help break the stigma surrounding mental illness.
  • A prayer for self-compassion and releasing shame.

Resources:

 

For more episodes of Dear Gabby head to http://www.deargabby.com/

The following are helpful resources and books I mention in the episode.

MENTAL HEALTH RESOURCES

Safety, Recovery and Mental Health Resources: https://bit.ly/3vnhU2o 

Mental Health Resources and My Story of Recovery from Postpartum Anxiety and Depression: https://bit.ly/3gEVG6u 

MIRACLE MEMBERSHIP

Want even more support? I created the Miracle Membership to help you design a spiritual practice you can stick to—so you can feel connected, supported and inspired every day. This is the key to manifesting a life beyond your wildest dreams. Each month I deliver new workshops, guided meditations, live group meditations, community connection and so much more. Plus, it’s easy to access on your phone, computer or tablet. Click here to join: https://bit.ly/3cJyiE0 

BOOKS

The Body Keeps the Score, by Bessel van der Kolk https://amzn.to/3xyyOxt

 

Produced by Dear Media.
